page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: In September 1916 a German Zeppelin crashed in Billericay killing the crew We visited Mary Needham who was aged eight at the time. Her parents were the Master and Matron of the Workhouse On this night Miss Needham was asleep with her sister when her terrified mother woke her. The Zepplin in flames seemed certain to crash on their home. Mrs.Needham said"If we are to die we shall die together",and got into bed with her daughters.Fortunatley the Zepplin drifted on and finally crashed into a field in Green's Farms Lane. Mr.Needham and his son joined the hundreds of people who came from as far away as London to see the wreck.The farmer's mangold crop was ruined and he had to wait for three years for compensation.Billericay was "on the map "at last!.
